instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message:
the board has no water damage it came in with bad screen and no sound i change screen but no sound it says no audio found 
<CHIP>U6200</CHIP>
 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SO</SIGNAL> 1.8v
<SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>HDA_SYNC</SIGNAL> 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message: Check all the resistors and traces between PCH and audio codec (HDA bus),

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message:
The diode measurement on the HDA lines was around
<SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT</SIGNAL> .886
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL>    .916
<SIGNAL>HDA_SYNC</SIGNAL>    .916
<SIGNAL>HDA_BIT_CLK</SIGNAL> .903
<SIGNAL>8409_HDA_SDINO_R</SIGNAL> .840

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message: I meant to check the value of the 33 ohm resistors placed between PCH and audio codec; like <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR>/01, etc...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message:
I can't believe...
Can you check if all mentioned resistors have 33 ohm and good traces continuity???
I never asked to check diode mode to ground!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1302</RESISTOR> = 35 ohm
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1303</RESISTOR> = 35
<SIGNAL>HDA_SYNC</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR> = 35
<SIGNAL>HDA_BIT_CLK</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1301</RESISTOR> = 35
<SIGNAL>8409_HDA_SDINO_R</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R6203</RESISTOR> = 35
all the traces i can see look ok

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message: can you recommend where to get them

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message: Any from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/07/08 should work...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message: I Tried another audio codec. still nothing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No audio device. everything else works
threads.message:
Possibly broken traces, or knocked off components.
Or even PCH internal problem...
